content:
Having a portable Wi-Fi hotspot can be a lifesaver when navigating Japan, especially with Google Maps and online resources. Here are some popular options and their estimated costs:

**1. Japan Wi-Fi Auto**: A popular option among tourists, Japan Wi-Fi Auto offers a portable Wi-Fi hotspot with unlimited data and a maximum speed of 150 Mbps. Rental fees:
	* 4G LTE: ¥540 (around $5) per day, ¥2,160 (around $20) for 4 days, ¥4,320 (around $40) for 7 days
	* 4G LTE Premium: ¥720 (around $7) per day, ¥2,880 (around $27) for 4 days, ¥5,760 (around $54) for 7 days

**2. Wi2fly**: Wi2fly offers a portable Wi-Fi hotspot with unlimited data and a maximum speed of 187 Mbps. Rental fees:
	* 4G LTE: ¥500 (around $5) per day, ¥1,800 (around $17) for 4 days, ¥3,500 (around $33) for 7 days
	* 4G LTE Premium: ¥800 (around $8) per day, ¥2,800 (around $27) for 4 days, ¥5,500 (around $52) for 7 days

**3. Ninja Wi-Fi**: Ninja Wi-Fi offers a portable Wi-Fi hotspot with unlimited data and a maximum speed of 225 Mbps. Rental fees:
	* 4G LTE: ¥400 (around $4) per day, ¥1,400 (around $13) for 4 days, ¥2,800 (around $27) for 7 days
	* 4G LTE Premium: ¥600 (around $6) per day, ¥2,200 (around $20) for 4 days, ¥4,400 (around $42) for 7 days

**4. Sakura Mobile**: Sakura Mobile offers a portable Wi-Fi hotspot with unlimited data and a maximum speed of 150 Mbps. Rental fees:
	* 4G LTE: ¥450 (around $4) per day, ¥1,600 (around $15) for 4 days, ¥3,200 (around $30) for 7 days

**5. Google Fi**: If you're a Google user, you might consider using Google Fi, which offers international data coverage in Japan. You'll need to purchase a Google Fi SIM card or use your own compatible device. Data rates:
	* $10 per GB (up to 6 GB), then $0.01 per MB

**Tips:**

* All of these options offer unlimited data, but speeds may be throttled after a certain amount of data usage.
* Be sure to check the coverage and speed in the areas you plan to visit.
* Some options offer additional features like power banks or travel adapters.
* You can also consider purchasing a prepaid SIM card or renting a phone with a local number.
* Make sure to return the device on time to avoid extra fees.

Before making a decision, consider your data needs and the areas you'll be visiting. If you're unsure, you can always opt for a shorter rental period and extend it if needed.

Remember to order your portable Wi-Fi hotspot in advance to ensure availability and to have it delivered to your hotel or accommodation in Japan.
